CatDescriptText: Mr. Alexander Fleming, trucker, 845 Inwood Street was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 28, 1959, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that education standards should be the same throughout the city school system or should they be lowered in order to accommodate the slower-learning pupils, particularly those who suffer the handicaps of poor home or neighborhood environments?" answer reads: "I think that the standards should be lowered.  However, this does not mean that there would be no encouragement to learn.  The attention directed towards each child should be increased."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alexander Fleming wearing goatee, dark cap, and dark sweater with hole, holding plaid coat and paper bag, standing in front of store with "sale" signs
